prompt:
Here is the context of the meme: "[10] Guy (also known as "Really High Guy" and "Stoner Stanley") is an advice animal image macro series featuring a photo of a young man who appears to be under the influence of marijuana. The captions typically portray stereotypical stoner behavior, similar to Stoner Dog, such as giving invalid answers to misunderstood questions and craving junk food. In April 2021, UK-based resident Connor Sinclair revealed himself to be the man depicted in 10 Guy after nearly a decade of anonymity.". First, based the given context, read the text in this image and explain the meme. Then, provide information for the following categories: 
 Visual Elaboration (focus on the main content): 
 Detected Text: 
 Meaning of the Meme (briefly):
respond:
The meme features a photo of a young man with a caption that reads, "I tried to brainstorm once but I got lost in the fog." The text is overlaid on the image, and the meme is a play on words, combining the idea of brainstorming with the stereotypical stoner behavior of being lost in the fog, which is a reference to the disorienting effects of marijuana.

Visual Elaboration:
The image shows a young man with a relaxed expression, which is consistent with the stereotype of a stoner. He is holding what appears to be a mobile phone, which is a common activity for someone who is high on marijuana. The background is blurred, which is a common effect in photos taken while under the influence of marijuana, as it can cause difficulty focusing on the camera.

Detected Text:
The text "but I got lost in the fog" is a pun, playing on the idea of brainstorming, which is a process of generating, evaluating, and refining ideas, and the phrase "get lost in the fog," which is a colloquial expression for being disoriented or confused.

Meaning of the Meme:
The meme is a humorous take on the stereotype of a stoner who is so high that they are unable to think clearly or come up with ideas, even when they are trying to brainstorm. It plays on the idea that marijuana can impair cognitive function and make it difficult to focus or think clearly. The meme is likely intended to be funny to those who understand the stereotype and the reference to the effects of marijuana.
